title: Drawing, "View of the Palazzo Barberini; Six Landscapes by Vincenzo Martinelli; Sixteenth Century Capitals, Bologna", 1809–1910
medium: Pen and bistre ink, brush and  brown wash over traces of graphite on cream laid paper
markings: Watermark: lily in double oval over A F C
inscribed:
Inscribed under top left:  "Palazzo Barberini Roma."  Under each of the Martinellis is written his name and "Bologna".  
Written in the center of the bottom row:  "monvmenti/del cinqve/cento Bologna". 
Left bottom corner "55"; top left: "110".  
On Verso: top right:  "111".
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Recto: page divided into eight parts, from left to right: Palazzo Barberini shown from rear; view of seashore; two views of castle towns surrounded by mountains;   all works by Martinelli.  At bottom: six left halves of capitals.  Verso: top: pitcher with handle on top; Dionysus represented on body.  Two-handled vase; "1814" written on it.  Pitcher with handle, shown sidewise.  Center row:  two-handled kraters.  Bottom row:  two-handled bottle.  Vase with snakes as handles.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "View of the Palazzo Barberini; Six Landscapes by Vincenzo Martinelli; Sixteenth Century Capitals, Bologna", 1809–1910.
1809–1910. Pen and bistre ink, brush and  brown wash over traces of graphite on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-469.
